intro: Acetosella divaricata, commonly known as the variable sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are often reddish or purple in color, especially when exposed to full sun. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments, it is a popular choice for gardeners seeking to add texture and color to shaded gardens.
